turns.content: What are some popular snowboarding destinations in Europe, and what is the average length of ski season?

Some popular snowboarding destinations in Europe are:

1. Chamonix, France
2. Zermatt, Switzerland
3. St. Anton, Austria
4. Val d'Isere, France
5. Verbier, Switzerland
6. Cortina d'Ampezzo, Italy
7. Davos, Switzerland
8. Mayrhofen, Austria
9. Tignes, France
10. Whistler, Canada (which is not in Europe, but is a popular destination for Europeans)

The length of the ski season varies depending on the location and altitude. Alpine resorts typically open from late November to early December and close between late April to early May. Resorts at higher altitudes may stay open longer, usually until late May or even June. Some indoor snow centres offer skiing and snowboarding all year round.
